short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Copy multiple selected areas by pattern

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
The browser extension to automate your everyday copy-paste routine.

The most exciting feature of the extension is to mark multiple areas on a web page, group them, and copy all at once in two clicks.

Areas in a group might be placed in arbitrary order, allowing you to create templates. The extension will automatically respect the template order when copying.

But it won't make a sense when copying from a single page. That's why one might specify URL patterns, e.g. https://amazon.com/dp/*, and the extension will auto-detect similar text areas on all similar pages.

Moreover, if you need to copy-paste between tabs, just open a source and a destination tab - and paste auto-prepared pattern from the source tab in two clicks (one is needed to open a context menu)!

More features, probably AI, are coming.

Any feedback is welcome!
